name: DoubleTree by Hilton Aberdeen City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Hotel staff is friendly, rooms range from good to great. Stay at the newer platinum club wing if you can, otherwise ask for a family room (extremely spacious). Service was excellent. Easy walk to beach boardwalk, and 15 min walk to center of Union St.
reviews.title: Fine hotel. Frequent guest.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Heated indoor pool is nicest I've found in Abdn.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Had a excellent one night stay at this hotel for my birthday. We got an upgrade to a Premier Room which overlooked the sea, had a lovely meal in the restuarant and couldnt fault a thing. All the staff are so friendly and helpful. We have stayed at many hotels both here and abroad and this one is up with the best. Well done everyone keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Footdee Restaurant: worst meal I have had in years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had dinner last night in Footdee restaurant within DoubleTree. It was the worst food I have had in years.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both myself and my friend had the fillet steak. We asked for it to be medium rare. I asked for boiled potatoes not fries and we ordered a side of mixed veg and peppercorn sauce.
reviews.title: another great weekend spent here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Doubletree have a Platinum Club, which is their brand of executive room. In this hotel, the Platinum Club rooms are housed in an entirely separate building adjacent to the main hotel. This means that there is no problem with noise from functions. The Platinum Club building is in a very quiet location, and entirely traffic-free. Most rooms have good sea views. Ample parking.
reviews.title: Comfortable Executive Room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was well equipped for a business stay, with wi-fi, internet, trouser press and iron. The minibar contained a small box of chocolates, fresh milk, orange juice, Pepsis and bottles of water, all complimentary.
reviews.title: Good as always

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: The hairdryer in the bathroom was one of those paltry hose affairs, that make a lot of noise, but not much hot air. Definite bad mark. Another weak point in the bathroom was the inadequate extractor fan: take a shower, and the walls and mirror get coated with steam.
reviews.title: Sleep deprivation to the point its almost funny.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Like most Aberdeen hotels, there is no air-con in the bedroom. Usually it doesn’t matter, but if you’re (un)lucky enough to strike a heatwave, the room will probably be warmer than you would like. There is a user-adjustable heater.
reviews.title: BRILLIANT STAFF and BREAKFAST!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Downstairs, the Platinum Club lounge has its own bar (drinks served 24/7), but there is no period of free drinks, as in Hilton Exec lounges. It’s a nice place to do some work or have a chat and a drink. There are two complimentary computer terminals. Breakfast is available in the same place. They call it continental breakfast, but the range of food is indistinguishable from a standard full breakfast. Scrambled eggs are the default, but you can order any other type. This breakfast is included in your room rate.
reviews.title: Weekend away with platinum comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yup, it was a nice touch to get a warm chocolate cookie as you check in. This is a very nice hotel located a little outside city center. Across the way is the beach/boardwalk. The breakfast was great and the room was spacious. The service was exceptional.
reviews.title: It's all about the cookie!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Lets start with the positive
reviews.title: Avoid this dump

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: the atrium is pleasent
reviews.title: Don't go here if you're at all disabled

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the staff are pleasent
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we ate on the first night and the food was above average
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with caring staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: I have just returned from a two night stay at the Doubletrees. I was there with my mum and we had a twin Platinum room. The whole stay was excellent. Nothing could be faulted. The room was large and had a great view over the sea. The breakfast was excellent as was the service.
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking forward to returning in October
reviews.title: Felt ripped of

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in Aberdeen for a 50th birthday party at the Beach Ballroom, a great night. However we had decided to stay at this hotel which is within walking distance. The day before I received an email with an offer of a meal, 2 courses for £15.00 or 3 for £20; sounded a good offer. Arrived in the restaurant to be given a very restrictive menu when I queried that this was not what I expected I was told the menu was on the email. I had to accept that I had it wrong. I asked if we could have the ala-cart menu and they could deduct £15 of the cost I was told impossible. Anyway the meal arrived, processed gnocchi which was totally tasteless. Then a pork steak dish was equally tasteless and no vegetables. I tried to get the assistant restaurant managers attention but she blatantly ignored me.
reviews.title: Fitted the bill perfectly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived back at the hotel to a very hot stuffy room with no air conditioning and only a small window which could open half an inch in the roof. Blasting music till 1.00am the most uncomfortable sleep I have had in a long time.
reviews.title: loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Complained to the manager when checking out told the same about the dinner offer. I checked it out when I returned home, no mention of the menu content in the email. Did they not know or were they being blatantly dishonest? The hot room was because the weather had been exceptionally hot. The loud blasting music was a charity auction, (so that was all right then).
reviews.title: Satisfactory hotel with good service

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Aberdeen City Centre Hotel
